member.name: M:fool_api.Areas.HelpPage.ApiDescriptionExtensions.GetFriendlyId(System.Web.Http.Description.ApiDescription)
member.summary: Generates an URI-friendly ID for the . E.g. "Get-Values-id_name" instead of "GetValues/{id}?name={name}"

member.name: T:fool_api.Areas.HelpPage.HelpPageConfig

member.summary: This class will generate the samples for the help page.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets CLR types that are used as the content of or .

member.summary: Gets the objects that are used directly as samples for certain actions.

member.summary: Gets the objects that are serialized as samples by the supported formatters.

member.name: P:fool_api.Areas.HelpPage.HelpPageSampleGenerator.SampleObjectFactories
member.summary: Gets factories for the objects that the supported formatters will serialize as samples. Processed in order, stopping when the factory successfully returns a non- object.
member.remarks: Collection includes just initially. Use SampleObjectFactories.Insert(0, func) to provide an override and SampleObjectFactories.Add(func) to provide a fallback.

member.summary: This represents an image sample on the help page. There's a display template named ImageSample associated with this class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:fool_api.Areas.HelpPage.InvalidSample
member.summary: This represents an invalid sample on the help page. There's a display template named InvalidSample associated with this class.

member.name: T:fool_api.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator
member.summary: This class will create an object of a given type and populate it with sample data.

member.name: M:fool_api.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator.GenerateObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates an object for a given type. The type needs to be public, have a public default constructor and settable public properties/fields. Currently it supports the following types: Simple types: , , , , , etc. Complex types: POCO types. Nullables: . Arrays: arrays of simple types or complex types. Key value pairs: Tuples: , , etc Dictionaries: or anything deriving from . Collections: , , , , , or anything deriving from or . Queryables: , .
member.returns: An object of the given type.

member.name: T:fool_api.Areas.HelpPage.SampleDirection
member.summary: Indicates whether the sample is used for request or response

member.name: T:fool_api.Areas.HelpPage.TextSample
member.summary: This represents a preformatted text sample on the help page. There's a display template named TextSample associated with this class.

member.summary: A custom that reads the API documentation from an XML documentation file.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The physical path to XML document.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.BrandsController.GetBrands
member.summary: This request returns a list of all brands.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.BrandsController.GetBrand(System.Int32)
member.summary: This request returns a specific brand.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.BrandsController.GetProductsByBrand(System.Int32)
member.summary: This request provides products associated with a given BrandId.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.BrandsController.PutBrand(System.Int32,fool_api.Models.Requests.BrandRequest)
member.summary: This request allows you to update a Brand name.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.BrandsController.PostBrand(fool_api.Models.Requests.BrandRequest)
member.summary: This request allows you to create a new Brand.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.BrandsController.DeleteBrand(System.Int32)
member.summary: This request allows you to delete a Brand. Note that the brand will be DELETED, rather than having its status updated.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.CustomersController.GetCustomer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get Customer detail by ID.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.CustomersController.GetOrdersByCustomer(System.Int32)
member.summary: This request will return a list of Orders placed by the Customer. Customer Details are not included in the response to this request.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.CustomersController.PutCustomer(System.Int32,fool_api.Models.CustomerRequest)
member.summary: Use this method to update a Customer record. You may only update the Customer's FirstName, LastName, or EmailAddress. Each of these fields is optional in the request.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.CustomersController.PostCustomer(fool_api.Models.CustomerRequest)
member.summary: This action creates a new Customer. The Customer will have their status automatically set to "Active." The CustomerId must be set to 0 in the request to successfully create a new Customer.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.CustomersController.DeleteCustomer(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method will update the Customer Status to "Deleted." An empty response to this request indicates success.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.OffersController.GetOffers
member.summary: This request returns all Offers with an Active status.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.OffersController.GetOffer(System.Int32)
member.summary: This request returns details for a specific Offer. Note that this returns details regardless of Offer order; this means this request can be safely used where it's necessary to display expired Offers (such as in an Order History page).

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.OffersController.PutOffer(System.Int32,fool_api.Models.Requests.OfferRequest)
member.summary: This request allows you to modify an Offer. The ProductId cannot change and you must submit the ProductId in the request.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.OffersController.PostOffer(fool_api.Models.Requests.OfferRequest)
member.summary: This method allows you to create a new Offer. A ProductId must be supplied in the request. The Offer will be created with a default status of Active.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.OffersController.DeleteOffer(System.Int32)
member.summary: This request allows you to update an Offer's status to Deleted. A successful request will return an empty response.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.OrdersController.GetOrder(System.Int32)
member.summary: This request returns details for a specific order.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.OrdersController.PutOrder(System.Int32,fool_api.Models.Requests.OrderRequest)
member.summary: This request allows you to update an Order. Note that the Status field is the ONLY thing you may change for an existing Order. All other request parameters will be ignored.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.OrdersController.PostOrder(fool_api.Models.Requests.OrderRequest)
member.summary: This request allows you to create a new Order. The response will contain the new Order. The OrderId and Status in the request body must be 0.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.OrdersController.DeleteOrder(System.Int32)
member.summary: This request will update an Order's staus to 0. A successfull request will return an empty response.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.ProductsController.GetProducts
member.summary: This request returns a list of all Products.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.ProductsController.GetOffersByProduct(System.Int32)
member.summary: This request will return a list of Offers associated with a given product.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.ProductsController.GetProduct(System.Int32)
member.summary: This request returns details for a specific product.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.ProductsController.PutProduct(System.Int32,fool_api.Models.Requests.ProductRequest)
member.summary: This request allows updating of a Product. The response to this request is an object containing the updated Product record. The Status and Brand fields must be the ID of the new Status or Brand. The Term must be either "monthly" or "annually." All fields are optional.

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.ProductsController.PostProduct(fool_api.Models.Requests.ProductRequest)
member.summary: This request creates a new Product. The response contains the newly created Product object. The Product will be assigned a status of Active by default. You must provide a ProductId and Status of 0. The Term must be either "monthly" or "annually."

member.name: M:fool_api.Controllers.ProductsController.DeleteProduct(System.Int32)
member.summary: This request allows you to update a Product's status to Deleted. A successful request will return an empty response.
